GlooKit.GlooAPI

Class GlooBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooAPI.GlooBatch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultBatch, TextBatch

    public abstract class GlooBatch
extends java.lang.Object
    GlooBatches are large collections of primitives that will be drawn to the screen. Each GlooBatch contains a Batch (see below) and some additional methods to transfer info to the GPU
    See Also:
    see "Game.Batches.UserBatch" for an implementation Author: Duncan Walter Documenter: Eli Jergensen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GlooBatch.Batch
      A Batch is a collection of sub-batches (which are referenced by channels) Batch is basically a list of list of drawing objects Each list of drawing objects is a sub-batch (channel) In addition to containing the batches, they also hold lists of vertices and indices buffers When an object is added to a batch, it must be added to a particular channel This allows for multithreading to occur as each thread can addBatch a processed drawing object to a particular channel that no other thread is modifying (thereby avoiding synchronization!) Note that while the channels get reset each frame, the buffers persist, ensuring that the game runs faster

      • render

        public void render(int primitiveType)
        This non-abstract method eventually gets called after each batch-specific render method. batch.render() calls the render method in batch, which is threadable, to process all the vertices
        See Also:
        Batch is a local class in this file (see below) After all the vertices are processed, they are send to the GPU through buffers and the batch is cleared for the next frame
